verses.verse: Now it came to pass in the fourteenth<WH702> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396>, that Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> came up<WH5927> against all the fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>, and took them<WH8610>.

And he stood<WH5975> by the conduit<WH8585> of the upper<WH5945> pool<WH1295> in the highway<WH4546> of the fuller<WH3526>'s field<WH7704>.

Then came forth<WH3318> unto him Eliakim<WH471>, Hilkiah<WH2518>'s son<WH1121>, which was over the house<WH1004>, and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe<WH5608>, and Joah<WH3098>, Asaph<WH623>'s son<WH1121>, the recorder<WH2142>.

And Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559> unto them<WH559>, Say you now to Hezekiah<WH2396>, Thus says<WH559> the great<WH1419> king<WH4428>, the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>, What confidence<WH986> is this where you trust<WH982>?
I say<WH559>, say you<WH8193>, (but they are but vain words<WH1697>) I have counsel<WH6098> and strength<WH1369> for war<WH4421>: now on whom do you trust<WH982>, that you rebel against me<WH4775>?

Behold<WH982>, you trust in the staff<WH4938> of this broken<WH7533> reed<WH7070>, on Egypt<WH4714>; whereon if a man<WH376> lean<WH5564>, it will go<WH935> into his hand<WH3709>, and pierce<WH5344> it<WH6547>: so is Pharaoh king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> to all that trust in him<WH982>.

But if you say<WH559> to me<WH982>, We trust in the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430>: is it not he<WH1116>, whose high places and whose altars<WH4196> Hezekiah<WH2396> has taken away<WH5493>, and said<WH559> to Judah<WH3063> and to Jerusalem<WH3389>, You shall worship<WH7812> before<WH6440> this altar<WH4196>?

Now therefore give pledges<WH6148>, I pray you<WH113>, to my master the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>, and I will give<WH5414> you two thousand<WH505> horses<WH5483>, if you be able<WH3201> on your part to set<WH5414> riders upon them<WH7392>.

How then will you turn away<WH7725> the face<WH6440> of one<WH259> captain<WH6346> of the least<WH6996> of my master<WH113>'s servants<WH5650>, and put your trust<WH982> on Egypt<WH4714> for chariots<WH7393> and for horsemen<WH6571>?

And am I now come up<WH5927> without<WH1107> the Lord<WH3068> against this land<WH776> to destroy<WH7843> it<WH3068>? the Lord said<WH559> unto me<WH5927>, Go up against this land<WH776>, and destroy it<WH7843>.

Then said<WH559> Eliakim<WH471> and Shebna<WH7644> and Joah<WH3098> unto Rabshakeh<WH7262>, Speak<WH1696>, I pray you<WH5650>, unto your servants in the Syrian language<WH762>; for we understand<WH8085> it<WH1696>: and speak not to us in the Jews<WH3066>' language, in the ears<WH241> of the people<WH5971> that are on the wall<WH2346>.

But Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559>, Has my master<WH113> sent<WH7971> me to your master<WH113> and to you to speak<WH1696> these words<WH1697>? has he not sent me to the men<WH582> that sit<WH3427> upon the wall<WH2346>, that they may eat<WH398> their own dung<WH2716>, and drink<WH8354> their own piss with you<WH7272>?

Then Rabshakeh<WH7262> stood<WH5975>, and cried<WH7121> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> in the Jews<WH3066>' language, and said<WH559>, Hear<WH8085> you the words<WH1697> of the great<WH1419> king<WH4428>, the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>.
Thus says<WH559> the king<WH4428>, Let not Hezekiah<WH2396> deceive<WH5377> you<WH3201>: for he shall not be able to deliver you<WH5337>.

Neither let Hezekiah<WH2396> make you trust<WH982> in the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, The Lord<WH3068> will surely<WH5337> deliver<WH5337> us<WH5892>: this city shall not be delivered<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>.

Listen<WH8085> not to Hezekiah<WH2396>: for thus says<WH559> the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>, Make<WH6213> a agreement with me by a present<WH1293>, and come out<WH3318> to me<WH398>: and eat you every one<WH376> of his vine<WH1612>, and every one<WH376> of his fig tree<WH8384>, and drink<WH8354> you every one<WH376> the waters<WH4325> of his own cistern<WH953>;
Until I come<WH935> and take you away<WH3947> to a land<WH776> like your own land<WH776>, a land<WH776> of corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492>, a land<WH776> of bread<WH3899> and vineyards<WH3754>.

Beware lest Hezekiah<WH2396> persuade<WH5496> you<WH559>, saying, The Lord<WH3068> will deliver<WH5337> us<WH376>. Has any of the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> delivered<WH5337> his land<WH776> out of the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804>?
Where are the gods<WH430> of Hamath<WH2574> and Arphad<WH774>? where are the gods<WH430> of Sepharvaim<WH5617>? and have they delivered<WH5337> Samaria<WH8111> out of my hand<WH3027>?

Who are they among all the gods<WH430> of these lands<WH776>, that have delivered<WH5337> their land<WH776> out of my hand<WH3027>, that the Lord<WH3068> should deliver<WH5337> Jerusalem<WH3389> out of my hand<WH3027>?
But they held their peace<WH2790>, and answered<WH6030> him not a word<WH1697>: for the king<WH4428>'s commandment<WH4687> was<WH559>, saying, Answer him not<WH6030>.

Then came<WH935> Eliakim<WH471>, the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah<WH2518>, that was over the household<WH1004>, and Shebna<WH7644> the scribe<WH5608>, and Joah<WH3098>, the son<WH1121> of Asaph<WH623>, the recorder<WH2142>, to Hezekiah<WH2396> with their clothes<WH899> torn<WH7167>, and told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of Rabshakeh<WH7262>.
